accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.p: UTU New York State Legislative Director Files #5711. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.p: Related Collections: 5141: Brotherhood of Locomotive Firemen and Enginemen Records 5622: UTU New York State Legislative Board Selected Files 5623: Brotherhood of Railroad Trainmen Legislative Board of New York Files

did.unittitle: Senate Int. 2055, Assembly Int. 2727: Amendment to Labor Law, in relation to rules of Board of Standards and Appeals affecting railroad, Pullman and Express employees
Legislation: Maintenance and Equipment of a Caboose and/or Rider Car (electric lighting facilities)
Senate Int. 1390, Assembly Int. 3154: Print 1446 to Amend the Tax Law, Print 3301 in relation to the optional 10 percent deduction
Senate Int. 2665, Print 2894; Assembly Int. 3861, Print 4319: Legislation to amend Section 49 of the Public Service Law to determine method of rate fixing for Railroad Companies
Senate Int. 2250, Print 2448; Assembly Int. 2620, Print 2775: Amends Section 54 Railroad Law Maintenance and Equipment of Passenger Cars
Legislation regarding Section 28, Sanitary Law and Section 196, Weekly Pay Law. Definition of word "employee"
Legislation: To amend tax law, relation to allowance of a credit to a resident for taxes paid other states for the taxes upon and with respect to personal incomes.

Legislation: To amend Public Service Law, in relation to power of Public Service Commission to order continuance or restoration of train services where direct operating costs of train can be shown to exceed aggregate gross revenues to be derived therefrom
Senate Int. 911, Print 940: Amending Public Authorities law of New York City Transit Authority regarding status of employees covered by labor agreement.

scopecontent.p: Also Senate Int. 2422, Print 2511: regarding fees for medical examination as condition of employment. Assembly Int. 1642, Print 1681: Amend Labor Law regarding cashing of checks

did.unittitle: Int. 2876, Print 2988 (Drumm Bill): To amend existing labor law to prohibit use of economic pressure or organizational picketing to coerce any person or employee to join a particular labor organization
Assembly Int. 3653m Print 3795: Amend Labor Law relation to power of Board of Standards and Appeals to make variations from rules

scopecontent.p: Amends 54-b, Railroad Law, to include passenger train with fuel-electric engines in provision that it shall be manned with not less than one engineer, one fireman or helper, and to provide that there shall be an assistant or co-engineer.

did.unittitle: Assembly Int. 863, Print 872; Senate Int. 583, Print 599 (Bauer-Ostrander Bill): Equipment of track motor cars used by railroads for transporting employees
Legislation: An act to amend the public service law

scopecontent.p: An act to amend the public service law, in relation to the duty of the commission to provide protective measures for employees of railroad and railway express operations in cases of abandonments, mergers, and consolidations.
Senate Bill introduced by Mr. Milmoe, Assembly Bill introduced by Mr. McMullen.

did.unittitle: Legislation: Amend Railroad Law, relation of clearance distances between adjacent tracks and between tracks and adjacent overhead structures
Senate 267, Print 267 (Long Island Railroad): Regarding proposed fare increase in passenger rates; amendment requires prior PSC approval.
Governor's Committee on Improper Labor and Management Practices: Questions for Discussion at Public Hearing
Legislation: To amend tax law, in relation to allowance of credit to resident for taxes paid to other states for taxes with respect to incomes
Legislation (General): To provide more adequate assistance to the blind - certain labor bills and other legislative bills
Assembly Int. 1869, Print 1890; Senate Int. 1891, Print 1987 (Track Motor Car)

scopecontent.p: Assembly bill introduced by Ostrander; Senate bill introduced by Bauer

did.unittitle: Legislation: New York State Income Tax Law
Legislation: Convalescent Care Policies. Senate Int. 1438 to amend Section 250; Assembly Int. 1881 regarding insurance laws.

scopecontent.p: Senate Bill introduced by Brydges, Assembly Bill introduced by Brook

did.unittitle: Labor Racketeering Bill: Senate Int. 3687 Prints 4258 and 4267; Assembly Int. 4330, Print 4907
Int. 1234 Print 1235: To amend Executive Law in regards to the creation of an office of transportation within the executive department
Budget Bill Assembly 2818, Print 2874 (Same as Drumm Bill Assembly 2945, Print 3001)

scopecontent.p: To amend the tax law in relation to the allowance of a credit to a resident for taxes paid to other states for taxes upon and with respect to personal income. Also includes other bills.

did.unittitle: Election Law: Application of law relative permitting railroad employees two hours off from actual service in order to vote in public elections
Legislation: Repeal of Section 1986 of Penal Law, relating to placing passenger cars in front of other railroad cars
Senate Introduced 513, Print 513: Concurrent resolution in Senate and Assembly regarding the purchase and rental commuter railroad cars by Port Authority New York
Assembly Int. 3054 Print 3129: Amendment to Caboose Law
Senate Resolution 24; Assembly Resolution 64: Investigate Railroad freight-passenger service

scopecontent.p: Introduced by Harold A. Jerry, Junior and Edwyn E. Mason, respectively.
